conclusion: To compare average velocities, calculate the average velocity for each car using total displacement divided by total time.
The area under a velocity-time graph represents the displacement of the object.
For Car A, the area under the curve from t=0 to t=t1 is a combination of a rectangle and a triangle.
The rectangle for Car A has an area of v1 * t1.
The triangle for Car A has an area of 0.5 * (v2 - v1) * t1.
Total displacement for Car A is 0.5 * (v1 + v2) * t1.
For Car B, the area under the curve from t=0 to t=t1 is a trapezoid.
Total displacement for Car B is 0.5 * (v1 + v2) * t1.
Average velocity for Car A is 0.5 * (v1 + v2).
Average velocity for Car B is 0.5 * (v1 + v2).
The average velocities of Car A and Car B are equal.
